DOCNAME: CASE OF MOLTENI AND GHISI v. ITALY
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection rejected (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial awards;Costs and expenses award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were respectively born in DATE and DATE and live in GPE .
CARDINAL . E.G. , the first applicant 's husband and the second applicant 's father , was the owner of a flat in GPE , which he had let to R.M.
CARDINAL . In a registered letter of DATE , the owner informed the tenant that he intended to terminate the lease on expiry of the term on DATE and asked him to vacate the LOC by DATE .
CARDINAL . In a writ served on the tenant on DATE , the owner reiterated his intention to terminate the lease and summoned the tenant to appear before ORG .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , which was made enforceable on DATE , ORG upheld the validity of the notice to quit and ordered that the premises be vacated by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the owner served notice on the tenant requiring him to vacate the premises .
CARDINAL . On DATE , he informed the tenant that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . Between CARDINAL DATE and DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as , the owner was not entitled to police assistance in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the owner died and the applicants inherited the flat and became part of the proceedings as heirs .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as the applicants were not entitled to police assistance in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the tenant died and the applicants recovered possession of the flat .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice is described in the ORG 's judgment in the case of ORG ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE ) .
